title.value: The effect of gestational age on short- and long-term complications following primary esophageal atresia repair
title.justification: The title is mentioned at the very beginning of the document as the main focus of the study.
title.quote: The effect of gestational age on short- and long-term complications following primary esophageal atresia repair

extractions.description: This study investigates the impact of gestational age on gastroesophageal and respiratory complications during the first 5 years of life in patients who underwent primary esophageal atresia repair. It is a retrospective chart review conducted at Montreal Children’s Hospital.

type.justification: The study conducts a retrospective chart review to gather and analyze data on patients, indicating that it is based on empirical evidence.
type.quote: We conducted a retrospective chart review including all patients who underwent primary surgical repair at Montreal Children’s Hospital between 2005 and 2023, using a predefined paper-based Case Report Form (CRF).

name.justification: The study is focused on the medical outcomes related to esophageal atresia repair, which falls under the broader category of medical research.
name.quote: Esophageal Atresia (EA) is a rare congenital anomaly with an incidence of 1.2 to 4.5 per 10,000 live births.

name.justification: The research is specifically about surgical repair in children, indicating it falls under pediatric surgery.
name.quote: A total of 137 patients underwent esophageal atresia repair and were included in this analysis.

name.justification: Since the study involves factors like gestational age and prematurity, which are key interests in neonatology, it can be classified under this field.
name.quote: Prematurity was defined as babies born alive before 37 weeks of pregnancy.
